marketNews.title: October 2024 Car Sales Highest During 2024
marketNews.content: The Association of Indonesia Automotive Industries (Gaikindo) noted that national car wholesales in October 2024 amounted to 77,191 units (-3.9% YoY, +6.2% MoM), marking the highest monthly sales since the beginning of 2024. Although still lower compared to last year, the level of the YoY decrease is narrowing. This result brought national wholesale sales for 10M24 to 710,408 units (-15% YoY), equivalent to 83.6% of Gaikindo's 2024 target which had been revised down to 850,000 units. The Chairman of Gaikindo, Yohannes Nangoi, stated that they are targeting national car wholesale sales in 2025 to recover to the 1 million unit level along with the trend of falling interest rates and the growth of electric vehicle infrastructure outside of Java and Bali. In October 2024, Astra International (ASII) recorded a sales decline of -1.9% YoY, but this was still better than the industry average decline of -3.9% YoY. This result caused ASII's market share to increase to 56.5% (vs. October 2023: 55.3%). By brand, Daihatsu was the main supporter of ASII car wholesales in October 2024 with stable sales of 14,096 units (-0% YoY, +11.2% MoM), while Toyota+Lexus sales reached 27,211 units (-1.6% YoY, +6.3% MoM). Cumulatively, ASII recorded wholesale of 401,398 units (-13.8% YoY) during 10M24, relatively better than the industry decline. Meanwhile, among ASII's main competitors, Mitsubishi recorded the relatively best performance with sales of 7,900 units (-3.3% YoY, -3.2% MoM) in October 2024, resulting in Mitsubishi's sales during 10M24 reaching 82,187 (-9.3% YoY). On the other hand, ASII's other main competitor, Honda, recorded the most negative performance in October 2024 and 10M24. Meanwhile, BYD successfully recorded sales of 2,488 units in October 2024 with a market share of 3.2%, surpassing Wuling (2.9%) and Hyundai (2.2%). Key Takeaway: We suspect the improving wholesale sales figures, which successfully exceeded 75,000 units in October 2024 - the highest monthly figure during 2024 - may be caused by increasing demand from the corporate fleet segment following political certainty post-cabinet announcement. The stock prices of automotive issuers have already reflected the improving trend in car sales. Therefore, regarding the outlook for automotive issuers going forward, we assess that investors need to pay attention to the wholesale trend in the next 2 months, whether sales figures can be sustained in the range of 75,000-80,000 per month and even improve further. This is necessary to estimate whether the annual sales recovery to the 1 million unit level in 2025 is realistic to achieve or will actually be revised downwards.

tickerNews.title: INCO Announces Partner for US$1.4 Billion HPAL Project
tickerNews.content: Vale Indonesia (INCO): Vale Indonesia announced a cooperation with GEM Co., Ltd., a Chinese battery material producer, to build a 1.4 billion US dollar HPAL smelter in Central Sulawesi. This smelter is projected to produce 60,000 tons of nickel in the form of mixed hydroxide precipitate per year. Bloomberg reported that GEM Co., Ltd. will hold up to 25% shares in the project, while INCO holds 30%, and the remainder will be owned by a third party to be announced later. Besides the HPAL smelter, GEM Co., Ltd. and INCO are also considering the construction of anode and precursor plants.

tickerNews.title: TOBA Subsidiary Signs Agreement to Acquire 100% of Sembcorp Environment Pte. Ltd. for S$405 Million
tickerNews.content: TBS Energi Utama (TOBA) through its subsidiary, SBT Investment 2 Pte Ltd., signed a share purchase agreement for 100% of the shares of Sembcorp Environment Pte. Ltd. from Sembcorp Industries Ltd. The total transaction value reached 405 million Singapore dollars or approximately 4.8 trillion rupiah. Sembcorp Environment Pte. Ltd. is an integrated waste management service provider in Singapore.

tickerNews.title: PSAB expects new gold prospect to yield 70,000-100,000 ounces per year for over 10 years
tickerNews.content: J Resources Asia Pasifik (PSAB) announced that the discovery of a new gold prospect at its subsidiary's mine is expected to produce around 70,000-100,000 ounces of gold per year for more than 10 years, based on production simulations from gold inventory optimization results and initial economic analysis. With these positive results, PSAB hopes that the continuation of drilling programs and other developments can be carried out soon.

tickerNews.title: KEJU plans 4:11 bonus share distribution and share buyback up to IDR 7.5 Billion
tickerNews.content: Mulia Boga Raya (KEJU) plans to distribute bonus shares at a ratio of 4:11 from the share premium reserve amounting to 206.3 billion rupiah as of December 31, 2023. The cum date in the regular and negotiation markets is December 23, 2024, with distribution on January 20, 2025. In addition, KEJU plans to conduct a share buyback of 4.9 million (0.33%) shares with a fund allocation of up to 7.5 billion rupiah, implying a buyback price of up to 1,535 rupiah per share. Both plans will be discussed at the EGM on December 17, 2024.

tickerNews.title: HATM Plans Rights Issue up to 1.8 Billion New Shares, Dilution up to 20.45%
tickerNews.content: Habco Trans Maritima (HATM) plans to hold a rights issue of up to 1.8 billion new shares with a dilution effect of up to 20.45%. The exercise price has not been announced, while the proceeds are intended for loan repayment and/or capital expenditure. This plan will be discussed in the EGM on December 18, 2024.

tickerNews.title: KKGI Plans Interim Stock Dividend Ratio 190:3 from Treasury Shares
tickerNews.content: Resource Alam Indonesia (KKGI) plans to distribute an interim stock dividend at a ratio of 190:3 from treasury shares amounting to 61.2 billion rupiah as of December 31, 2023. The cum date in the regular and negotiation markets is December 30, 2024, with distribution on January 17, 2025. This plan will be discussed at the EGM on December 18, 2024.

tickerNews.title: AMRT Commissioner Sells 2.7 Million Shares at Average Price of IDR 3,306
tickerNews.content: The Commissioner of Sumber Alfaria Trijaya (AMRT), Budiyanto Djoko Susanto, sold 2.7 million AMRT shares at an average price of 3,306 rupiah per share on November 5, 2024. The total transaction value reached approximately 9 billion rupiah. After this transaction, Budiyanto Djoko Susanto's ownership in AMRT decreased from 0.335% to 0.328%.

tickerNews.title: Motorcycle Domestic Sales Reached 544,392 Units in October 2024
tickerNews.content: The Indonesia Motorcycle Industry Association (AISI) noted that domestic motorcycle sales reached 544,392 units (+5.4% YoY, +3% MoM) in October 2024, resulting in 5.4 million units (+3.4% YoY) for 10M24, equivalent to 83-87% of AISI's 2024 target of 6.2-6.5 million units.

tickerNews.title: Indonesia and China Sign US$10 Billion Agreements
tickerNews.content: Indonesia and China on Sunday (10/11) signed agreements worth US$10 billion at the Indonesia-China Business Forum in Beijing. The two countries agreed to increase collaboration in various sectors, such as electric vehicles, lithium batteries, photovoltaics, and the digital economy. Indonesia and China also pledged to strengthen partnership in the global energy transition and jointly ensure the security of global mineral supply and industrial chains.

tickerNews.title: Consumer Confidence Index (CCI) Dropped to 121.1 in October 2024
tickerNews.content: Bank Indonesia noted that the Consumer Confidence Index (IKK) in October 2024 decreased to 121.1 (vs. September 2024: 123.5), marking the lowest level since December 2022. This result was pressured by the decline in the Current Economic Conditions Index (IKE) to 109.9 (vs. September 2024: 113.9) and the Consumer Expectations Index (IEK) to 132.4 (vs. September 2024: 133.1).

tickerNews.title: Bitcoin Reaches All-Time High of US$81,899 Following US Election Sentiment
tickerNews.content: Bitcoin set an all-time high price of US$81,899 today, Monday (11/11), following positive sentiment from Donald Trump's victory in the US presidential election and the election of several pro-crypto candidates to the US Congress. Previously, Trump promised during his campaign to make the US the "crypto capital of the planet" and envisioned the formation of a strategic Bitcoin inventory. Trump also mentioned appointing pro-digital asset financial regulators and firing the Chairman of the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC), Gary Gensler, who is known for leading crackdowns on cryptocurrencies.

tickerNews.title: RAJA President Director Buys 2 Million Shares at Average Price of IDR 1,725
tickerNews.content: The President Director of Rukun Raharja (RAJA), Djauhar Maulidi, bought 2 million RAJA shares at an average price of 1,725 rupiah per share on November 1 and 7, 2024. The total transaction value reached approximately 3.4 billion rupiah. After this transaction, Djauhar Maulidi's ownership in RAJA increased from 0.047% to 0.095%.

tickerNews.title: SGER Clarifies to IDX Regarding Coal Supply Dispute with Vietnamese Customer
tickerNews.content: Sumber Global Energy (SGER) stated in a clarification to the IDX that based on an independent surveyor's assessment, SGER has supplied coal to its Vietnamese customer, Danka Minerals Joint Stock Company (Danka), with specifications matching the sales purchase agreement. SGER also explained that based on the contract, the parties agreed that ownership and risk concerning the cargo transfer to Danka immediately upon loading onto the vessel at the loading port. SGER also requested the Vietnamese Embassy in Indonesia to disregard Danka's claim and facilitate dispute resolution between the two parties by referring Danka to the Singapore International Arbitration Centre (SIAC). Previously, Danka, through the Vietnamese Ministry of Industry and Trade, sent a letter to the Indonesian Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources, alleging that SGER had committed fraud regarding the calorie value of the supplied coal.

tickerNews.title: IFII to Distribute Interim Dividend for 2024 Fiscal Year IDR 5 per Share
tickerNews.content: Indonesia Fibreboard Industry (IFII) will distribute an interim dividend for the 2024 fiscal year amounting to 47.1 billion rupiah or 5 rupiah per share. The cum date in the regular and negotiation markets is November 19, 2024, with payment on December 3, 2024. Referring to IFII's stock price at the close of trading on Monday (11/11) at 204 rupiah per share, the indicative dividend yield is 2.5%.

tickerNews.title: POWR Commissioner Buys 1.3 Million Shares at Average Price of IDR 713
tickerNews.content: The Commissioner of Cikarang Listrindo (POWR), Iwan Putra Brasali, bought 1.3 million POWR shares at an average price of 713 rupiah per share on November 5, 2024. The total transaction value reached approximately 916 million rupiah. After this transaction, Iwan Putra Brasali's ownership in POWR increased from 0% to 0.0081%.
